intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. zerbanum, commonly known as the Zerbanum hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a distinctive coloration, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense inflorescence. This subspecies is noted for its limited distribution and is considered a rare plant in its native range.
